practice_questions.question: Choose the correct form: La mesa _____ (blanco)
practice_questions.explanation: Mesa is feminine singular, so the adjective becomes 'blanca'.

practice_questions.question: Select: Los gatos _____ (negro)
practice_questions.explanation: Gatos is masculine plural, so the adjective becomes 'negros'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Las flores _____ (bonito)
practice_questions.explanation: Flores is feminine plural, so the adjective becomes 'bonitas'.

practice_questions.question: Choose: El libro _____ (interesante)

practice_questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in -e don't change for gender, only number. Mesa is singular.

practice_questions.explanation: Estudiantes is plural. Adjectives ending in -e add -s for plural.

practice_questions.question: Choose: Las sillas _____ (cómodo)
practice_questions.explanation: Sillas is feminine plural, so the adjective becomes 'cómodas'.

practice_questions.question: Select: La profesora _____ (simpático)

practice_questions.question: Complete: Los exámenes _____ (fácil)
practice_questions.explanation: Exámenes is plural. Adjectives ending in consonants add -es for plural.

practice_questions.question: Choose: Las ciudades _____ (grande)
practice_questions.explanation: Ciudades is plural. Adjectives ending in -e add -s for plural.

practice_questions.question: Select: El clima _____ (tropical)
practice_questions.explanation: Clima is masculine singular. Adjectives ending in consonants don't change for gender.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Las manos _____ (limpio)
practice_questions.explanation: Manos is feminine plural, so the adjective becomes 'limpias'.

test_questions.question: Choose the correct form: La mesa _____ (blanco)

test_questions.question: Select the correct form: Los libros _____ (rojo)
test_questions.explanation: Libros is masculine plural, so the adjective becomes 'rojos' (masculine plural).

test_questions.explanation: Chicas is feminine plural, so the adjective must be 'altas' (feminine plural).

test_questions.question: Choose the correct form: El perro _____ (pequeño)
test_questions.explanation: Perro is masculine singular, so the adjective remains 'pequeño' (masculine singular).

test_questions.question: Select: Una casa _____ (grande)
test_questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in -e don't change for gender, only number. Casa is singular, so 'grande'.

test_questions.question: Complete: Los estudiantes _____ (inteligente)
test_questions.explanation: Adjectives ending in -e add -s for plural. Estudiantes is plural, so 'inteligentes'.

test_questions.question: Choose: Las flores _____ (azul)

test_questions.question: Select the correct form: El examen _____ (fácil)

test_questions.explanation: Problemas is masculine plural. Adjectives ending in consonants add -es for plural: 'difíciles'.

test_questions.question: Choose: La profesora _____ y _____ (joven, simpático)
test_questions.explanation: Profesora is feminine singular. 'Joven' doesn't change for gender, but 'simpático' becomes 'simpática'.

practice_questions.question: Choose the correct position: Una casa _____ (blanca/white)
practice_questions.explanation: Descriptive adjectives usually go after the noun: 'casa blanca'.

practice_questions.question: Select the correct order: A _____ man (good)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Bueno' becomes 'buen' before masculine singular nouns and goes before.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Una _____ mujer (great)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Grande' becomes 'gran' before singular nouns and means 'great'.

practice_questions.question: Choose: El _____ día (first)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Primero' becomes 'primer' before masculine singular nouns.

practice_questions.question: Select: Una mesa _____ (wooden)
practice_questions.explanation: Material adjectives go after the noun, often as 'de + material'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Un _____ problema (bad)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Malo' becomes 'mal' before masculine singular nouns.

practice_questions.question: Choose: La _____ página (third)
practice_questions.explanation: Ordinal numbers usually go before the noun: 'tercera página'.

practice_questions.question: Select: Un coche _____ (red)
practice_questions.explanation: Color adjectives go after the noun: 'coche rojo'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Una _____ idea (good)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Bueno' stays as 'buena' with feminine nouns and can go before for emphasis.

practice_questions.question: Choose: El _____ capítulo (last)
practice_questions.explanation: Ordinal adjectives like 'último' usually go before the noun.

test_questions.question: Choose the correct position: Una camisa _____ (azul/blue)
test_questions.explanation: Color adjectives go after the noun: 'camisa azul'.

test_questions.question: Select: Una casa _____ (stone)
test_questions.explanation: Material descriptions use 'de + material' after the noun.

test_questions.question: Choose: La _____ vez (first)
test_questions.explanation: Ordinal numbers go before the noun: 'primera vez'.

test_questions.question: Select: Un perro _____ (small)
test_questions.explanation: Size adjectives can go before or after; after is more common.
